answers.answer: I get this a lot even though all I do is drink water all day and I'm 30+2. If your body wants more water it's probably for a reason but deff talk to your doctor.  Sometimes if we drink too much water it over works our kidneys and most of the water we drink just gets directly poured out when we pee.
Typically we should be drinking twice as much water now that we're pregnant which is 132 oz  and with the heat it's best to stay hydrated

Yes that's normal. What you really want to watch in your urine. It's the best way to tell how hydrated your are because everyone's body size is different not everyone needs the same amount of water. If it's completely clear like water you might be drinking a little too much, if it's slightly tented yellow your good, if it starts to get darker yellow or have a strong smell you need to drink more water.

It's definitely normal, I went through that phase but if pure gaining weight quickly it may be something to bring up with your doctor because it can be normal but it can also be a sign of gestational diabetes!

question: 18 weeks and I'm extremely thirsty. I can drink three bottles of water and still feel so dehydrated? Is this normal or could something be wrong?
title: EXTREME THIRST
